intro: Staelia schumannii, commonly known as the Schumann's staelia, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in nutrient-poor, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold climates. Staelia schumannii plays a role in stabilizing soil in its harsh environment and is an important part of the tundra ecosystem.
